about_the_game:
A “city-building” x “tower defense” simulation game featuring Fio, a girl who protects a dying world.

The multi-island forest world of Morin is on the verge of extinction due to the invasion of hot winds and monsters blowing from far away.

Fio and his guardians, the Flora Bears, are tasked with building the last human city while protecting the “ark dwellers”.

They can build various facilities to increase the number of inhabitants and resources, build defense facilities needed for battle, and strengthen their characters.

To protect your city from powerful bosses, hold out until you are ready for a support attack with a ridiculously large beam cannon, and defeat the bosses with super-exhilarating attacks!

Translated with (free version)

City building

Consume building materials and money to build facilities. Building houses increases the number of residents, and residents can use facilities such as fields and logging camps to produce more and more resources. You can use the collected resources to build defense facilities and strengthen your allied units, Florabears.

Battle flow

Battles basically begin by accepting a quest.

There are three basic operations: "Place Flora Bears", "Retreat", and "Activate Skills".

Each type of Flora Bear has a different attack and defense range, so understand the characteristics of the enemy units attacking you and place them appropriately according to the situation.

Skills that become available over time can also greatly affect the battle situation when activated.

As the story progresses, a boss battle will occur. The boss is very tough, but you can use your trump card, the "Giant Beam Cannon". Buy time until the boss is ready to fire, then fire the beam and win!

 Strengthen Flora Bears

There are 7 types of Flora Bears, and you can set up to 5 skills for each. Skills have a big impact on battles, so create more powerful combinations.

Florabear's status will become stronger as the level increases, and can also be strengthened during town building.

Planting "roses", "pansies" and "tulips" around Florabear's habitat will increase the corresponding parameters. Arrange the flowers wisely to grow them efficiently.

About defense facilities

Defense facilities are one of the important elements in clearing quests. Building several of them in the town building part will give you an advantage in battle. Defense facilities have set HP and effective ranges, so build them in places where they can be used to the fullest.

Synopsis

Morin, an archipelago forested world. This land was once covered with lush forests, but the hot winds and beast attacks from far away are taking away people's homes one by one.

The "Ark Dwellers" escaped the winds of destruction and reached an island at the edge, where they built their last hope. The last habitable city of humanity, with its giant beam cannon and towers reaching the sky. It was also a symbol of the determination to resist the fate of destruction.

The grave keeper girl Fio also loses her foster father Ozzy to death on the harsh journey to escape the winds of destruction. However, she is entrusted with one hope.

"If nine flowers bloom on that seedling, one wish will come true."

At the time of parting, a "mysterious seedling" that only Fio can see sprouts from the seed that Ozzy entrusted to her. As she holds the mysterious seedling, Fio remembers Ozzy's last words in her heart. "You will save the world!"

Eventually, Fio, along with the "Florabears," who appear out of nowhere and stay by her side, takes on the mission of being a "guardian" who protects the "Ark Dwellers" from the winds of destruction.

However, Fio has another wish. To regain the days of memories she lost with Ozzy. Should she grant her wish, or do her best to save the people?

As the "life she must protect" and "her wish" intersect, what will Fio ultimately choose? The saga of a girl's growth and determination, woven together with her gigantic beam cannon, begins now!
